Class BoundedBuffer<T>

java.lang.Object
  BoundedBuffer<T>
Type Parameters:
T - Type of elements
public class BoundedBuffer<T>
extends Object

A bounded buffer is a FIFO queue with a limited number of elements that can be stored in it. This data structure supports two main operations: enqueue and dequeue. As this data structure supports multi-threading, these operations block the calling thread if the buffer is full (in enqueue) or empty (in dequeue).

 void setDone()

public BoundedBuffer(int capacity)
Constructor. Initializes a new bounded buffer with a given capacity.

Parameters:
capacity - Capacity
Method Detail

dequeue

public T dequeue()
Dequeues next element from the queue. This method blocks if the buffer is empty, or returns null if it is empty and the done flag is set.

Returns:
First element of queue, or null if queue is empty and set as done.

enqueue

public void enqueue(T item)
Enqueues an element as the last one in queue. This method blocks if the buffer is full.

Parameters:
item - Element to enqueue

getCapacity

public int getCapacity()
Returns the capacity of the buffer.

Returns:
Capacity of the buffer

getSize

public int getSize()
Returns current size of the queue.

Returns:
Number of elements currently in queue

setDone

public void setDone()
Sets the queue as done and releases any thread waiting for a dequeue operation.
